resources.CarInventoryManagement

Class Management

  • java.lang.Object
    • resources.CarInventoryManagement.Management

  • public class Management
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Management()
      Default constructor creates an ArrayList of Car objects called db.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addCar(java.lang.String lp, java.lang.String make, java.lang.String model, int year, double price)
      Adds a car to the runtime database, (assuming all the fields validate correctly).
      boolean deleteCar(java.lang.String lp)
      Deletes a car from the runtime database, (assuming the car existed).
      java.util.ArrayList<Car> getCars()
      Simply a way to retrieve the existing database held in memory.
      boolean readDB()
      Attempts to read in from the database file called cars.txt and load each car's info into the runtime database.
      boolean saveDB()
      Attempts to write the existing runtime database to the database file.
      int search(java.lang.String s)
      Given a license plate, attempts to locate the car in question in the runtime database.
      java.util.ArrayList<Car> showPriceRange(double lower, double higher)
      Allows filtering of the runtime database by a price range.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Management

        public Management()
        Default constructor creates an ArrayList of Car objects called db. This ArrayList will serve as the runtime database.

    • Method Detail

      • getCars

        public java.util.ArrayList<Car> getCars()
        Simply a way to retrieve the existing database held in memory.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList db

      • addCar

        public boolean addCar(java.lang.String lp,
             java.lang.String make,
             java.lang.String model,
             int year,
             double price)
        Adds a car to the runtime database, (assuming all the fields validate correctly). This does not mean that the information will necessarily end up in the database file! The database file is only written upon exiting the program normally!
        Parameters:
        lp - The license plate of the new car.
        make - Make of the new car
        model - Model of the new car
        year - Year of the new car, can't be before cars were invented, in 1896.
        price - Price of the new car, can't be less than free.
        Returns:
        True if the car was successfully added, false otherwise.

      • deleteCar

        public boolean deleteCar(java.lang.String lp)
        Deletes a car from the runtime database, (assuming the car existed). See cautionary note on the addCar method.
        Parameters:
        lp - The license plate of the car to be removed from the database
        Returns:
        True if a car was deleted, false otherwise

      • search

        public int search(java.lang.String s)
        Given a license plate, attempts to locate the car in question in the runtime database.
        Parameters:
        s - Accepts a string that is the license plate of the car being sought.
        Returns:
        The index of the matching car, if found. Otherwise returns -1.

      • showPriceRange

        public java.util.ArrayList<Car> showPriceRange(double lower,
                                      double higher)
        Allows filtering of the runtime database by a price range.
        Parameters:
        lower - The lower limit of the price range to be searched.
        higher - The upper limit of the price range to be searched.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of cars falling within the specified price range.

      • saveDB

        public boolean saveDB()
        Attempts to write the existing runtime database to the database file. The file will be overwritten, so hopefully this doesn't introduce any corruption.
        Returns:
        True if the database was successfully written, false if there was an IOException.

      • readDB

        public boolean readDB()
        Attempts to read in from the database file called cars.txt and load each car's info into the runtime database.
        Returns:
        True if the file existed and the information was successfully read into the ArrayList db, false otherwise.
